intro: Chuquiraga orthacantha, commonly known as the Andean burro's tail, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that are surrounded by bracts, giving it a unique appearance. It is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Chuquiraga orthacantha is often found in open areas such as slopes and grasslands, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
